Present location: INSTITUT DE PAPYROLOGIE ET D'ÉGYPTOLOGIE, UNIVERSITÉ DE LILLE III [02/049] LILLE
Technique: FORMED BY HAND; ENGRAVED; DECORATED ON THE POTTER'S WHEEL
Name: Cooking pot
Description: Cooking pot fashioned from coarse Nile clay mixed with an organic temper, but perfectly polished. The body is hemispherical with a restricted mouth and a lip, cut with a knife, in continuation of the body wall. The upper section of the body is decorated with diagonal hatching, crossed by two diagonal lines in opposite directions. The incisions were made with a wide instrument and are not deep. The bottom was not reinforced with agate, as was common practice, and is therefore damaged through use. The vessel is decorated with punctated dotted bands made with a swivelling serrated roller.
